questions.question: Which array method executes a provided function once for each array element?
Which method creates a new array populated with the results of calling a provided function on every element in the calling array?
Which method creates a new array with all elements that pass the test implemented by the provided function?
Which method applies a function against an accumulator and each element in the array to reduce it to a single value?
Which method is similar to reduce but processes elements from right to left?
Which method tests whether at least one element in the array passes the provided function's test?
Which method tests whether all elements in the array pass the provided function's test?
Which method returns the first element in an array that satisfies the provided testing function?
Which method returns the last element in an array that satisfies the provided testing function?
Which method returns the index of the first element in an array that satisfies the provided testing function?
Which method adds one or more elements to the end of an array?
Which method removes the last element from an array?
Which method removes the first element from an array?
Which method adds one or more elements to the beginning of an array?
Which method sorts the elements of an array in place?
Which method reverses the order of elements in an array?
Which method creates a new array that includes elements from existing arrays?
Which method creates a string from an array by joining elements with a specified separator?
Which method returns a shallow copy of a portion of an array into a new array object?
Which method changes the contents of an array by removing or replacing existing elements and/or adding new elements in place?
Which method copies a sequence of array elements within the same array?
Which method fills all the elements of an array with a static value?
Which method flattens a nested array up to a specified depth?
Which method maps each element using a mapping function, then flattens the result into a new array?
